title: X Corp.
content:
{{Short description|American social media company}}

'No Longer Exists.' Why Elon Musk Chose Nevada For X Holdings. |date=April 11, 2023 |last=Smith |first=Connor |work=[[Barron's (newspaper)|Barron's]] |access-date=April 11, 2023 |archive-date=April 12, 2023 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20230412031849/https://www.barrons.com/articles/twitter-nevada-musk-1f998f30 |url-status=live }}</ref>}}

{{Elon Musk series}}
'''X Corp.''' is an American [[technology company]] established by business magnate [[Elon Musk]] in 2023 as the successor to [[Twitter, Inc.]] It is a [[wholly owned subsidiary]] of '''X Holdings Corp.''', which is itself owned by Musk. The company owns the [[Twitter]] social networking service and has announced plans to use it as a base for other offerings.<ref>{{cite news|last=Brown|first=Ryan|title=Twitter partners with eToro to let users trade stocks, crypto as Musk pushes app into finance|date=April 13, 2023|agency=CNBC|url=https://www.cnbc.com/2023/04/13/twitter-to-let-users-access-stocks-crypto-via-etoro-in-finance-push.html|access-date=2023-04-13|archive-date=2023-04-13|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20230413082513/https://www.cnbc.com/2023/04/13/twitter-to-let-users-access-stocks-crypto-via-etoro-in-finance-push.html|url-status=live}}</ref>

==History==
===Conceptualization and planning (2022–2023)===
{{Further|Acquisition of Twitter by Elon Musk}}
In April 2022, filings to the [[Securities and Exchange Commission]] (SEC) revealed Musk had formed three corporate entities in [[Delaware]], all under the name of X Holdings. According to the filings, one of the entities was to merge with [[Twitter, Inc.]], while another was to serve as the parent company of the newly merged company. A third entity would then help take on a {{USD|13}} billion loan provided by various large banks to acquire [[Twitter]].<ref name="SlateInfo">{{Cite web |url=https://slate.com/technology/2023/04/twitter-inc-x-corp-elon-musk-x-nevada.html |title=Twitter Isn't a Company Anymore |date=April 10, 2023 |last1=Pahwa |first1=Nitish |last2=Joseph Stern |first2=Mark |work=[[Slate (magazine)|Slate]] |access-date=April 11, 2023 |archive-date=April 18, 2023 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20230418023557/https://slate.com/technology/2023/04/twitter-inc-x-corp-elon-musk-x-nevada.html |url-status=live }}</ref> The name "X" dates back to [[X.com]], an online bank co-founded by Musk in 1999. In June 2001, X.com became [[PayPal]].{{Sfn|Vance|2017|p=77-78}} Musk considered forming a holding company named "X" for [[Tesla, Inc.]] and [[SpaceX]] in August 2012.<ref>{{Cite web |url=https://www.reuters.com/article/us-tesla-spacex/musk-says-may-form-holding-company-for-tesla-spacex-idUSBRE87U0KR20120831 |title=Musk says may form holding company for Tesla, SpaceX |date=August 31, 2012 |publisher=[[Reuters]] |access-date=April 11, 2023 |archive-date=April 12, 2023 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20230412033240/https://www.reuters.com/article/us-tesla-spacex/musk-says-may-form-holding-company-for-tesla-spacex-idUSBRE87U0KR20120831 |url-status=live }}</ref> In July 2017, Musk reacquired the domain X.com from PayPal.<ref>{{Cite web |url=https://qz.com/1026167/elon-musk-just-bought-x-com-the-domain-he-once-owned-from-paypal |title=Elon Musk bought a web domain worth millions with "sentimental value" to him |date=July 11, 2017 |last=Huang |first=Echo |work=[[Quartz (publication)|Quartz]] |access-date=April 11, 2023 |archive-date=April 12, 2023 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20230412033241/https://qz.com/1026167/elon-musk-just-bought-x-com-the-domain-he-once-owned-from-paypal |url-status=live }}</ref> Musk reaffirmed his support for the name "X" in December 2020, replying to a Twitter user who renewed calls for Musk to form a new holding company under that name, although he dismissed the idea of acquiring his businesses to [[Chris Anderson (entrepreneur)|Chris Anderson]].<ref>{{Cite web |url=https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2022-04-21/musk-forms-x-holdings-after-hints-at-parent-for-tesla-spacex |title=Musk Forms 'X Holdings' After Hints at a Parent Company for Tesla, SpaceX |date=April 21, 2022 |last=O'Kane |first=Sean |publisher=[[Bloomberg News]] |access-date=April 11, 2023 |archive-date=April 16, 2023 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20230416071316/https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2022-04-21/musk-forms-x-holdings-after-hints-at-parent-for-tesla-spacex |url-status=live }}</ref>

The concept for X solidified in October 2022, when Musk tweeted that acquiring Twitter is "an accelerant to creating X, the [[Super-app|everything app]]". According to Musk, Twitter would accelerate the creation of X by "3 to 5 years". Musk expressed interest in creating an app similar to [[WeChat]]—a Chinese instant messaging, social media, and mobile payment app—on a podcast in May 2022.<ref>{{Cite web |url=https://www.nytimes.com/2022/10/06/technology/elon-musk-x.html |title=What Does X Mean to Elon Musk? |date=October 6, 2022 |last=Huang |first=Kalley |work=[[The New York Times]] |access-date=April 11, 2023 |archive-date=April 10, 2023 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20230410133325/https://www.nytimes.com/2022/10/06/technology/elon-musk-x.html |url-status=live }}</ref> In June, Musk told Twitter employees that Twitter is a "digital town square" that should be all-encompassing, like WeChat.<ref>{{Cite web |url=https://www.nytimes.com/2022/06/16/technology/elon-musk-twitter-employees-meeting.html |title=Elon Musk tells Twitter's employees he wants the service to 'contribute to a better, long-lasting civilization.' |date=June 16, 2022 |last=Isaac |first=Mike |work=[[The New York Times]] |access-date=April 11, 2023 |archive-date=January 14, 2023 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20230114225902/https://www.nytimes.com/2022/06/16/technology/elon-musk-twitter-employees-meeting.html |url-status=live }}</ref> In a [[Morgan Stanley]] conference in March 2023, Musk touted X once again as the potentially "biggest financial institution in the world".<ref>{{Cite web |url=https://www.forbes.com/sites/dereksaul/2023/03/07/musks-new-twitter-dream-become-biggest-financial-institution-in-the-world/ |title=Musk's New Twitter Dream: Become 'Biggest Financial Institution In The World' |date=March 7, 2023 |last=Saul |first=Derek |work=[[Forbes]] |access-date=April 11, 2023 |archive-date=April 12, 2023 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20230412040417/https://www.forbes.com/sites/dereksaul/2023/03/07/musks-new-twitter-dream-become-biggest-financial-institution-in-the-world/ |url-status=live }}</ref> On October 27, 2022, Musk [[Acquisition of Twitter by Elon Musk|acquired]] Twitter for {{USD|44}} billion, and subsequently became its [[Chief executive officer|CEO]].<ref>{{Cite web |url=https://www.nytimes.com/2022/10/27/technology/elon-musk-twitter-deal-complete.html |title=Elon Musk Completes $44 Billion Deal to Own Twitter |date=October 27, 2022 |last1=Conger |first=Kate |last2=Hirsch |first2=Lauren |work=[[The New York Times]] |access-date=April 11, 2023 |archive-date=October 29, 2022 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20221029090805/https://www.nytimes.com/2022/10/27/technology/elon-musk-twitter-deal-complete.html |url-status=live }}</ref>

===Formation (2023–present)===
In March 2023, Musk registered X Holdings Corp. and X Corp. in [[Nevada]]. On the same day, Musk registered the [[artificial intelligence]] (AI) company X.AI.<ref>{{Cite web |url=https://www.theverge.com/2023/4/14/23684005/elon-musk-new-ai-company-x |title=Elon Musk founds new AI company called X.AI |date=April 14, 2023 |last1=Peters |first1=Jay |last2=Roth |first2=Emma |publisher=[[The Verge]] |access-date=April 14, 2023 |archive-date=April 14, 2023 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20230414223834/https://www.theverge.com/2023/4/14/23684005/elon-musk-new-ai-company-x |url-status=live }}</ref> Later that month, Musk applied to merge X Holdings I with X Holdings Corp. and Twitter, Inc. with X Corp.<ref name="SlateInfo"/> In the filing, Musk revealed that X Holdings Corp. has {{USD|2}} million in capital; X Holdings Corp. will also serve as the parent company for X Corp.<ref>{{Cite news |url=https://www.irishtimes.com/technology/2023/04/11/ex-twitter-chief-executive-parag-agrawal-reveals-doj-probe-in-pursuit-of-legal-fees-repayment/ |title=Twitter becomes X Corporation as Musk advances 'everything app' hopes |last=Feeley |first=Jef |newspaper=[[The Irish Times]] |access-date=April 11, 2023}}</ref> In a company-wide email that month, Musk announced that Twitter employees will receive stock in X Corp.<ref>{{Cite web |url=https://www.nytimes.com/2023/03/26/technology/elon-musk-twitter-value.html |title=Elon Musk Values Twitter at $20 Billion |date=March 26, 2023 |last1=Conger |first=Kate |last2=Mac |first2=Ryan |work=[[The New York Times]] |access-date=April 11, 2023 |archive-date=April 11, 2023 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20230411034427/https://www.nytimes.com/2023/03/26/technology/elon-musk-twitter-value.html |url-status=live }}</ref>

In an April 2023 court filing for an ongoing lawsuit filed by right wing political activist [[Laura Loomer]] against Twitter and its former CEO [[Jack Dorsey]], Twitter, Inc. notified the court that it had been consolidated into X Corp., a Nevada corporation based in [[Carson City, Nevada|Carson City]]. A similar filing was made in the [[U.S. District Court for the Southern District of Florida]].<ref>{{Cite web |url=https://sfstandard.com/business/twitter-is-now-called-x-corp-and-no-longer-exists/ |title=Twitter Is Now Called X Corp and 'No Longer Exists' |date=April 11, 2023 |last=Gaus |first=Annie |work=[[The San Francisco Standard]] |access-date=April 11, 2023 |archive-date=April 11, 2023 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20230411211347/https://sfstandard.com/business/twitter-is-now-called-x-corp-and-no-longer-exists/ |url-status=live }}</ref>
[[File:Linda Yaccarino by James Tamim (cropped).png|thumb|[[Linda Yaccarino]] in 2014]]
On May 11, 2023, Musk tweeted that he had found a replacement as Twitter and X Corp.'s CEO. The next day, on May 12, he named [[Linda Yaccarino]] as the new CEO, adding that she "will focus primarily on business operations, while I focus on product design & new technology".<ref>{{Cite web |url=https://www.theverge.com/2023/5/12/23721107/twitter-ceo-linda-yaccarino-elon-musk-nbc |title=Twitter’s new CEO is Linda Yaccarino, a longtime ad exec for NBCU |date=May 12, 2023 |last=Roth |first=Emma |work=[[The Verge]] |access-date=May 12, 2023 |archive-date=May 12, 2023 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20230512160254/https://www.theverge.com/2023/5/12/23721107/twitter-ceo-linda-yaccarino-elon-musk-nbc |url-status=live }}</ref>
